text: A powerful practitioner of Necromancy, writing the book known as the Grimoire Necris, which allowed his ascension to undeath
Ancient  Necromancer
The Dread King was a mighty warrior, giant in stature, armed with a massive sword and covered in ancient heavy armour. He could cut down his enemies in their droves.
Mighty Warrior
A master in the lore of dark magic, able to summon vast armies of undead to fight for him.
Lord of the Undead
The being known as the Dread King was known to have been one of Nagash's most powerful followers, aiding him in his early attempts to bring undeath to the world, he served Nagash well
Dark Lord of Nagash
His vast knowledge of Necromancy allows him to effortlessly sustain his thralls.
Great Summoner
Dread Aura

The Dread King's name was derived from a powerful aura that surrounded him at all times, only the mightiest of beings could face him without physically shaking or panicking, most would be frozen in fear or outright flee
Skeletal Steed
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
Gaurgon
The Dragon Gaurgon, also called the Blazefang, was gifted to the Dread King by Nagash. The beast still faithfully serves its master in Undeath.
Soulreaper
This ancient sword, imbued with dark magic, steals the souls of all those it strikes down.
Heart of Blackness
The Black Jewel of the Dread King contains his very soul. Embedded in his rib cage, it beats like an obscene, black and glistening heart.
Grimoire Necris

Written by the Dread King himself during the reign of Nagash, its entire contents are committed to his ancient memory. Centuries later it fell into the hands of Larenscheld, from whom he learned about the the Dread Kingâ€™s legend.
Traitor King of Mahrak
Through his necromantic powers and whisperings on the Wind of Shyish, Nagash was able to turn this proud King.
Traitor King of Quatar
Through his necromantic powers and whisperings on the Wind of Shyish, Nagash was able to turn this proud King.
The Traitor of Mahrak
Liche High Priest and leader of the traitors that turned to Nagash.
Fallen Hero of Mycanes
A tragic hero that got killed by a wicked Medusa. Now he's possessed by a spiteful spirit.
Fallen Hero of Athanes
An ancient hero that couldn't prevail against a mighty Minotaur. Now he's possessed by a spiteful spirit.
Casket of Souls
When the souls are released they endeavour not to return without new victims to torment for eternity.
Skeletal Steed
Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.
Skeleton Chariot
The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.
Only those who display the correct degree of diligence and reverence may learn the secrets of Unlife.
By which the very souls of the Undead can be harnessed, so their physical forms can be controlled.
Corrupted Cult Scholar
Soul Binding
Nagash is darkness and unreasoning hatred given form, the father and creator of the foul art of necromancy and lord of all Vampires.
Nagash the Great Necromancer
Missile combat isn't always about attacking; knowing how to defend also pays dividends.
Bow Master
Death isn't necessarily the end; those who have pledged service must rise to fight again another day.
Sun-Scorched Bones
Formed by long campaigns and bloody slaughter in the stifling desert heat, the bond between steed and rider cannot be broken, even when death tries to intervene.
Elite Cavalrymen
The swift charioteers of the king. They who pursue the sovereign's foes on the day of his awakening.
Master Charioteers
Such evil creatures are desperate to spill mortal blood, and will speed along until they find some flesh to carve.
Evil Creatures
The Dark Magic-user can reanimate fearsome beasts to do his bidding.
Undead Horrors
The many ranks of archers and artillery batteries will darken the sky and reap many souls.
Darkened Skies
The desert itself is his steed.
Dune Rider
A dream of glory attained through conquest great rages still, despite the dying of the light.
Unfading Memory
The power of death cannot be denied.
Deadly Power

This spectre has been called back and bound to the world of the living against their will. This lead to such great hatred against everything and everyone magical that the sheer presence of the ghost is enough to disturb enchantments.
Mage Hunter
Many attacks directed against this creature are unexpectedly missing or deflected by a mysterious force.
Ectoplasmic Barrier
Poltergeists move unseen, creating chaos and destruction behind enemy lines.
Poltergeist
Sustained by the very life force of others, this creature is always on the prowl.
Life Essence Hunter
The essence of this apparition is so strong that it empowers  lesser ghosts by its very presence.
Packleader
Constant mourning, moaning and wailing is draining the fighting spirit of its enemies.
Wailing Spectre
Most mundane afflictions are unable to afflict a being which thrives between life and death.
Otherworldly Resilience
The secret teaching of Nagash provide unparralleled magical prowess.
Acolythe of Nagash
Bolstered by ancient curses and unholy magic, this entity is very difficult to destroy.
Eternally Bound
Instead of strengthening their own magical powers they invest a portion of it to sabotage enemy spellcasters.
Magic Saboteur
There is enough left of the heroes soul to occasionally cause outburst of desperate pain and torment, unsettling enemies who witness it.
Tormented Puppet
The legendary defender of Mycanes would hold his ground against almost anyone and anything. Pity it neither saved him nor his city.
Defender of Mycanes
Both Mycanas and its defenders have fallen long ago, yet its elite still marches to war.
Persemius' Warband
In a cruel twist of  irony the reanimated corpses of the minotaurs slain by Thesops are now forming his most elite retinue.
Risen Enemies
Once long ago Thesops was famous for hunting and slaying monsters. Neither his legend nor his home town endured, but an echo of his old skills still lingers in his corpse.
Monster Hunter
Even in undeath and without free will, Persemius will fight harder against the hated medusae and those who dare to harbour them.
Hatred for Dark Elves
Thesops died by specifically by a minotaur's hand, but his blind hatred extends to all Beastmen.
Hatred for Beastmen

The spirit binds the pitiful former hero to its undead form and will prevent him from falling apart until his corpse has been hacked to pieces. Not even that will grant the fallen peace though. Their tormentor will use their magic to reconstruct the skeleton, regardless of the damage it suffered and force it to march against the living once again.
Possessed
Persemius was renowned for his skilled use of shields. Even in death seems not have changed that.
Legendary Shieldbearer

The possessed corpse is infused with foul magic by its master, driven far beyond its physical limitations. Such powerful magic damages the corpse, but the malicious apparition controlling it does not care.
Overdrive
Thesops was the famous spellblade of Athanas. His legend died with his city, but an echo of his skill still endures, now serving a much darker master.
Legendary Swordsman
Warrior King of Nehekara
Traitors they may be, but in the distant past they too have been kings of Nehekara. Their skills still reflect that.
Mastercrafted Statues
Some Ushabtis are just of higher quality than others.
Nagash's Boon
There is much power to be gained by following Nagash.
Willingly Damned
It was their own decision to serve Nagash. Not that he cares, he will make use of his servants either way.
Dark Glory
Even in undead servitude of the greatest necromancer they remain inspiring to their soldiers. Or to what is left of them.
Artisan King
When the Tomb King turned traitor, he took his beloved retinue of famous Ushabti with him. Without Necrotects, the king himself must conduct the maintenance - which he does begrudgingly.
Royal Retinue
The Traitor King brought his personal guard with him when he turned to Nagash and they still protect him to this day.
Warlord
Their skills honed by endless war in life and death, the personal guard of the king is a formidable foe.
Silver-Tongued Traitor
It was Hierophant Haptmose who first defected to Nagash and it was Haptmose who convinced the other two to follow.
Hierophant of the Mortuary Cult
Highly skilled and knowledgable in the secrets of the Mortuary Cult, Haptmose has long worked on their perfection.
Nagash's Gifts
There is power to be gained in the service of Nagash, that much is undeniable.
Skilled Animater
So skilled is the traitorous Hierophant when awakening his legions that they move more fluently than most other undead.
Ascendant Liche
The better one serves Nagash, the more power he may bestow upon his servant. As long as they do never displease the great necromancer, their powers may never stop to grow.
